title: November GQ font
content:
Cool sans serif in the back of GQ this month. Anyone know it?

Font: 

 Peggo 

Solved By: 

 [akira1975](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114502/http:/typophile.com/user/4504 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [image.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114502/http:/typophile.com/files/image_206.jpg) | 1.38 MB |
author: tourists

comments.content:
I think this may be Montserrat, a free Google web font, that someone artificially widened and shortened (check out the |O|). The G is from Montserrat Alternates:  
 [http://www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Montserrat](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114502/http:/www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Montserrat "http://www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Montserrat")  
 [http://www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Montserrat+Alternates](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114502/http:/www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Montserrat+Alternates "http://www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Montserrat+Alternates")
